About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

US Naval Aircrew veteran: I joined the Navy in 2006 and became an Airborne Sensor Operator(ASO) conducting direct support missions in support of Special Operations Command. In 2010 I was honorably discharged and began working ASO contracts with SAIC special projects division (now part of Leidos).

Software Development: I've always wanted to learn software development. I would write small games while in the Navy in C++ simply to try and understand how programming works. I decided to take a 6 month break from deploying with Leidos to Afghanistan and focus solely on web development. I attended Nashville Software School during my 6 month break and found a position with ForceX.

Now: I've departed ForceX to contract in software development and hone my web development skills, where my passion really lies.
